qa_pair.question: one of the comments says wear a dust mask? why?
qa_pair.answer: Plasma cutters use the extreme heat of the plasma arc to not just melt, but vaporize the metal being cut. Exposure to long term inhalation of dusts can cause a class of lung diseases called pneumoconiosis, and in the case of iron dust the form is called siderosis. Other metals, such as galvanized or cobalt steel also release poisonous products. Wearing a dust mask is a wise precaution, even though the risks are very slim for the occasional hobby welder. Welding and plasma cutting should always be done in well ventilated areas.

rewrite.edit: If worn properly, a surgical mask is meant to help block large-particle droplets, splashes, sprays, or splatter that may contain germs (viruses and bacteria), keeping it from reaching your mouth and nose. Surgical masks may also help reduce exposure of your saliva and respiratory secretions to others.
Plasma cutters use extreme heat so you won't want to breath in dust long term as that can cause lung diseases. You also don't want to inhale poisonous products that come from metal.
Wearing a dust mask is a wise precaution, even though the risks are very slim for the occasional hobby welder. Welding and plasma cutting should always be done in well ventilated areas.

qa_pair.question: one of the comments says wear a dust mask? why?
qa_pair.answer: Cutting metal puts lots of nasty stuff in the air.  This torch vaporizes the steel because of the high temperature so I guess a mask makes sense.

qa_pair.question: one of the comments says wear a dust mask? why?
qa_pair.answer: The small amount of smoke that comes off is vaporized metal and mill scale, etc.  Best not to get anything in your lungs if you can avoid it.  But there's nothing unpleasant about the cutting process.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: No, Typically when you install vinyl siding it is best to hand nail, because you are not supposed to set the nails completely tight. You should leave a little wiggle for the siding to move.

rewrite.edit: You should leave a little wiggle for the siding to move
You should leave a little wiggle for the siding to move.
No, Typically when you install vinyl siding it is best to hand nail, because you are not supposed to set the nails completely tight.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: I would say no..   This guns shoots normal (small) head nails and I typically use roofing nails for installing vinyl siding.   You also need to leave the nails loose so the vinyl siding can expand and contract.  I think it would be hard to leave the nails loose with any power nailer.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: I normally use my Roofing Nailer with a vinyl siding depth adjuster. My Bostitch roofing nailer R46N uses a Vinyl siding adapter rn46. This prevents over driving the nail in to deep which allows the siding room to expand and contract during seasonal temperature changes.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: I used this nailer to install Hardiplank siding.  Its too powrful for vinyl siding.  Personally, I wouldn't install vinyl siding on a storage building, much less a house.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: Now I have used this gun on fiber cement. I believe this product can be used on vinyl siding. I think the trick would be adjusting your air pressure on the gun. If I am not mistaken I think vinyl siding should be nailed to give it room to expand and contract. so if you dial the pressure in right I can't see why this product wouldn't work.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: No this is for wood or Hardie siding. Roofing nailers will work.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this to install vinyl siding
qa_pair.answer: Absolutely! The nail heads are a bit small, but if you dial the regulated pressure on your compressor down to 50 psi or so, AND you drive the nails at an angle, they will consistently lay into the vinyl grooves with room for wiggle. (the head fits perfectly for nail placement) This speeds up putting up siding like nobody's business!

qa_pair.question: Can you plug it into a regular outlet?
qa_pair.answer: Yes it is normal house circuit, but a regular 15amp circuit will not be good enough.  You will have better luck with a 20amp,  You can tell by checking your panel box to see if you have a 20amp breaker or fuse controlling the receptacle you plan to use.  A 20 amp circuit will be connected to 12 gauge wire which is what you need to carry that much electricity. DO NOT just replace a 15amp breaker or fuse with a 20amp without making sure that that the wire is heavy enough to carry the 20amps.

qa_pair.question: Can you plug it into a regular outlet?
qa_pair.answer: Yes. Preferably grounded, though.

qa_pair.question: Can you plug it into a regular outlet?

qa_pair.question: Can you plug it into a regular outlet?
qa_pair.answer: This compressor runs at the limit of a typical household circuit capacity. A 20 Amp circuit is the proper one. Some people have damaged this same model compressor when using even short extension cords. So, be careful.  It needs to receive a full 120 volts in order to start and run properly.  Amclaussen.

qa_pair.question: What type of house coupler comes on the unit? Is it Industrial or Auto?

qa_pair.question: How weatherproof is this light?
qa_pair.answer: The LED light and sensor panel are well sealed from outdoor moisture.  The battery cover is removable and can't be sealed, but does have a close fit.  It may be wise to check the battery terminals for cleanliness when you change batteries.  The terminals can be cleaned with WD-40 and Isopropyl alcohol.  The WD-40 removes tarnish and corrosion then the alcohol removes the WD-40.

How is this light
The LED light and sensor panel are well sealed from outdoor moisture.

qa_pair.question: How weatherproof is this light?
qa_pair.answer: I had it over my garage door and the 1st night it rained, water got into the battery compartment and motion sensor. I put it in a bowl of rice for a few days and it got most out to the point to where it would work again. I put a sealant around anywhere that i thought water could get in and it's been great ever since.  It just doesnt look the greatest lol. So to answer your question, it isnt weather proof unless you make it that way. Hope i helped.

qa_pair.question: How weatherproof is this light?
qa_pair.answer: I had this light out in the Pennsylvania rain and snow all year and it works like a dream.

qa_pair.question: How weatherproof is this light?
qa_pair.answer: I put it under the eave of my mom's house and in about 2 months she said it didn't work too well. I took it down and it was all corroded up inside where the batteries go. Not sure what caused this but I put new batteries in it and it didn't come on, so I cleaned on it a little more and it still wouldn't work...so I tossed it. I don't think I'll buy another one. BTW she lives in Southwest VA. near TN./VA. line, so I don't think wet weather is an issue in this instance. They may have improved them now as this was over a year ago.RKG

qa_pair.question: How weatherproof is this light?
qa_pair.answer: Well, I have three.   One is inside a 7x7x7 refrigerated cooler as an emergency light should there be a power failure or some clown turns off the power -- works fine.   The other two are outside but under an overhang.   They do not get direct hits from rain but they do get the "weather" -- works fine.   They seem well built enough to take direct hits from water, essentially they're a glorified flash light with very little that can go wrong.   Plus you don't need to take out a second mortgage to buy one.....   I's say, give it a try..........

qa_pair.question: Will this install on studs that are 16-inch center to center?
qa_pair.answer: The simple answer is "yes" if you can be sure to hit each stud in order to securely anchor the chair. That being said, it also depends if this is new or old construction. If old, the studs may not be in the correct position for the chair to be used on the short wall so you may want to consider anchoring the chair on the long wall. If new construction, we highly recommend placing blocking in-between the studs (on end wall) so that you assure of secure anchoring.  Hope this helps!

qa_pair.question: Will this install on studs that are 16-inch center to center?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, but if possible, add blocking in-between studs and screw into the blocking.

I use this every day putting up and down. This will last a very long time. Built with quality.

qa_pair.question: What is needed to install this ( and grab bars) on acrylic shower? The sides of shower are accessible through walls.
qa_pair.answer: Installation requirements are the same regardless of shower wall composition. The items must be fastened to 2x4 framing members within the wall with heavy screws. Unless you are exceedingly lucky with placement of wall framing members in existing area, you will need to open the wall & add additional framing members. The same is true for grab bars.

summary: This product is made of high quality metal and wood. It has a flat metallic grey color that is darker than brushed nickel. The back of the seat is flat and 3/4" from the wall where it mounts. The teak wood holds up well but should be wipes down periodically with teak oil to maintain the darker color. It will lighten in color without this regular maintenance. The top two slats slide out completely. There is a small space behind the third. It is a very functional seat and can be easily cleaned with a moveable showerhead. Installation requirements are the same regardless of shower wall composition. The items must be fastened to 2x4 framing members within the wall with heavy screws. Unless you are exceedingly lucky with placement of wall framing members in the existing area, you will need to open the wall and add additional framing members. The same is true for grab bars. Be aware that you can pinch your fingers when folding the seat if you are not careful. You will need solid blocking behind the seat as the holes will not line up on the studs.

qa_pair.question: Hellois it mandatory to tin the tip before first use ?what is the recommanded solder tin ?
qa_pair.answer: To answer your question directly, it is not madatory but it does help. Tinning the tip(s) only takes a small amount of solder and helps the solder heat and flow easier. Just allow the iron to get hot, apply a bit of solder and then wipe clean. Use a rosin core solder with a thickness appropriate for the job. On circuit boards use a thin diameter (.093 or smaller) and then larger as the wire diameter increases. Hope this helps, I was a NASA certified solderer 40+ years ago when I worked in the R&D; Lab on the Apollo program.

qa_pair.question: Can these bits be used in a standard keyless chuck?
qa_pair.answer: No, They are designed specifically for SDS Plus type rotary hammer drills, not standard drills/hammer drills. They're built to slide up and down, and are not round where the a regular chuck would clamp them. If you need to drill into concrete, though, an SDS type drill and bits is the best way to go. It's night and day in the difference between using a regular drill with a hammer function and a rotary hammer drill and bit. Rotary hammer drills and bits cut like butter...at least my Bosch does. The bits last far longer and it cuts my labor time tremendously.

I found the Fein 921072K13 Step Adaptor is a perfect fit to the Makita, and the Bosch VAC005 5-Meter Vacuum Hose 35mm fits perfectly to the Fein and to my Shop Vac. This was a perfect solution with no modifications required to anything. The Bosch hose has a swivel at the tool end and is small and flexible enough to work perfectly with the Makita RO sander.

qa_pair.question: how easy is it to connect this to a shop-vac?  What is the size/shape of the port on the sander than a shop vac hose would connect to?
qa_pair.answer: It does not connect to a shop vac hose at all. I am returning mine. You might be able to cobble an adaptor with duck tape but why bother as other sanders are connectable. The little bag is not adequate for heavy sanding and a shop vac in necessary when doing heavy sanding to keep the dust down.

qa_pair.question: how easy is it to connect this to a shop-vac?  What is the size/shape of the port on the sander than a shop vac hose would connect to?
qa_pair.answer: No you cannot easily connect to a shop vac. The port coming off the sander is too small and the connector to the bag is oddly shaped so you can't even tape a hose to it. You could order a special adaptor from a third party and hope it doesn't fall off. For less money both DeWalt and Milwakee make sanders that easily accept shop vac hoses. There is much less dust when connected to the suction of a vac than used with just a tiny bag for collection.

qa_pair.question: How does a random orbital sander compare to a disk sander in application?  If you are finishing steel which is preferrable?
qa_pair.answer: The random orbital sander is more or less a finishing sander mainly for wood or plastic.  A disc sander used to reduce welds or heavy metal is a rather rough sander.  If you were to use a random orbital sander to do more than remove paint from steel, you would be sanding for a long time.

rewrite.edit: The product being an orbital sander is a finishing sander mainly for wood or plastic, compared to a disc sander which is used to reduce welds or heavy metal. The product would take a long time if used for removing paint from steel.
If you were to use a random orbital sander to do more than remove paint from steel, you would be sanding for a long time.

This product is suitable for finishing of wood or plastic and would not be ideal for more than minor jobs involving metal, as opposed to a disc sander that is rougher and more suitable for heavy metal.

qa_pair.question: How does a random orbital sander compare to a disk sander in application?  If you are finishing steel which is preferrable?
qa_pair.answer: The rigid oscillating edge belt/ spindle sander is worth checking too I have one and it really is worth every cent on wood I've never used it on metal. Which ever one you choose it's important to get the right sand paper

qa_pair.question: How does a random orbital sander compare to a disk sander in application?  If you are finishing steel which is preferrable?
qa_pair.answer: A disk sander spins In a continuous.circle and your supposed to only use one half of the disk for your sanding   a random orbit the pad orbits in tiny circles I forget what this one is 1/32 or something really it depends on the project but I like the random orbit because you can use the whole pad if it's a big project. For smaller projects I would use the disk sander so you can hold the piece with two hands

qa_pair.question: How does a random orbital sander compare to a disk sander in application?  If you are finishing steel which is preferrable?
qa_pair.answer: A lot depends on the project.  If the project is primarily wood, then the random sanders by your major manufacturers is the way to go.  If the project is manly metal (steel, etc.) then the way to go is the disc sander.  Disc sanders are more aggressive than the small electric sanders.  They are for smoothing and evening out glued up pieces.  Another way to look at it is to say if you want to remove a lot of material fast, use the disc sander.  For everything else, use the random orbit.

summary: This product is an orbital finishing sander used mainly for wood or plastic, compared to a disc sander which is used to reduce welds or heavy metal. The product is easy to connect to a shop vac through the port where the bag was connected. The voltage for this product is 110 volt AC. The port is about an inch and adaptor kits can be found for different sizes. The support grip has the ability to rotate and the knob unscrews enough to remove the band. It has an extra knob near the front and rear handle to make it super easy to use during long sanding periods. It comes with a cloth bag that fits on a 1/8th turn to release a hard rubber fitting and never falls off. It has a button in the handle to lock trigger on and a pad under the sanding disk that helps with maneuverability and command of the sander. Note that the product would take a long time to remove paint from steel.

qa_pair.question: Unable to link with 890MAX remotes. Can anyone help?

qa_pair.question: can it be used for a washing machine drain dry well
qa_pair.answer: Drain water from a washing machine is considered "greywater" and this well can certainly be used for it. "Blackwater," (which is sewage) is not allowed. Note: this has nothing to do with the color of the water, but rather the classification of the material being drained. Hope this helps....

qa_pair.question: Can this be used for water softener backwash? in Massachusetts?
qa_pair.answer: Most water softeners use a three step process to recharge the cartridge, The first is backwash, the second is the brine soak, the third is rinse. In most water softeners all three steps discharge liquid through the same tube. The second step is the problem.  If you use sodium chloride to recharge the resin cartridge the concentrated salt water will be discharged into the ground. You could switch to potassium chloride which is more expensive but less harmful to ground water.

You could switch to potassium chloride which is more expensive but less harmful to ground water.

qa_pair.question: Does this manometer measure flue pressure and home pressure with reference to the outdoors of a home.  will it do what a dg 700 manometer does.
qa_pair.answer: Well it will measure 2 different pressures at the same time. It will then give you the differential in real time. You have to toggle it  to see each pressure. It does not show each pressure at the same time. You would run your tubing to whatever place you want to reference pressure. The Dg 700 you referenced is for serious building pressure and tightness testing. This meter is great for reading pressures 1 to 60 inches. The Dg 700  meter is probably good for the low end. qa_pair.answer: You can remove the screw, but it's what holds the whole unit in place securely.  It will stay plugged, but with the screw it holds it in place in the wall.  You just remove the current switchplate and put this on in place of it.

qa_pair.question: Is that long screw at center of the plate necessary or can that screw be removed?
qa_pair.answer: The screw at the center of the plate is not necessary, it's just a way to secure the unit to the outlet it's plugged into.  This may be helpful when you have all six outlets plugged in and you don't want to inadvertently pull the whole thing out by pulling one of the cords out.

qa_pair.question: Can this lie flat for storage without everything falling out?
qa_pair.answer: No, unfortunately, it can't. The sides on the trays only go up so high, and there is no appreciable back to it. If it tips back, most of the contents of your drawers will spill out.

qa_pair.question: Are the drawers Polystyrene or Polypropylene?
qa_pair.answer: They are polypropylene.  Harder to see through than polystyrene but much more durable.  I'd trade the reduced visibility of contents for the increased durability any day. qa_pair.question: Does this have a timer that can be set?   One of the reviews said it does not have a timer.
qa_pair.answer: There is a timer but not a clock.  The start time is always determined by sunset or darkness.  The amount of "on" time after sunset is what you set (1 to 9 hours).  Or you can set it to be always on when it's dark out.

qa_pair.question: Does this have a timer that can be set?   One of the reviews said it does not have a timer.
qa_pair.answer: There is a photo sensor which you can set to turn on and off the lights.  It also can be set by number of hours by digital selection.  I usually set my for 4 hours when I use it.

qa_pair.question: Does this have a timer that can be set?   One of the reviews said it does not have a timer.
qa_pair.answer: It has a photo cell that will turn the transformer when its dark and you have a timer to keep it on up to 9 hours. To have the transformer turn on at a specific time will be possible only by connecting the transformer to a plug in timer

summary: This is a great product and is a good value for the price. The start time is always determined by sunset or darkness, and the amount of time this product stays on after sunset is able to be set to a specific number of hours. Unlike home store products, this product does not require you to use the same gauge wire in each terminal, and standard 10-gauge wire will work fine. The RMS wattage on this transformer is on an RMS wattage that works continuously with speakers. The product comes located on the cabinet and is 6ft tall.

qa_pair.question: Would this work in a golf cart or is there an automatic shutoff that would be tripped when bumps were hit?
qa_pair.answer: It could work OK since the demo video says the "tip-over shut-off" should turn it off with it turned about 45 degrees.  So rolling down or up a hill shouldn't kill it (if it's not too steep), yet impacts from a bump is hard to say if that would trigger it or not.  Just be careful about securing it and not having things that can burn too close to it in the direction the heat is aimed.

qa_pair.question: Would this work in a golf cart or is there an automatic shutoff that would be tripped when bumps were hit?
qa_pair.answer: Forget it!  Put on another layer of clothing or don't go golfing.  This heater hasn't been designed, in my opinion, to be use in moving vehicles.

qa_pair.question: Would this work in a golf cart or is there an automatic shutoff that would be tripped when bumps were hit?
qa_pair.answer: I would say no. We take ours to football games, and a couple of times it flamed out when the crowd got to stomping their feet. I'm sure it wouldn't work in a moving golf cart.

qa_pair.question: Would this work in a golf cart or is there an automatic shutoff that would be tripped when bumps were hit?
qa_pair.answer: There's a tilt sensor (switch) connected a  wire that go the the gas valve. The tilt sensor sensor is designed to switch off the gas when the heater is tilted approx. 45 degrees from gravity, zero degrees. The  tilt sensor also responds to being jolted without being tilted. Another problem you could run into under high winds is the pilot light may blow out. When the pilot light goes out the ODS shuts off the gas same as the tilt sensor.

qa_pair.question: Would this work in a golf cart or is there an automatic shutoff that would be tripped when bumps were hit?
qa_pair.answer: It would shut off more than likely and if it's breezy it will blow out the flame

Otherwise, you can buy the hose attachment for about 45.00 dollars and attach a large propane container (like you have on a barbeque grill) to the heater.  I only have used the small canisters.  Those are what fit my needs.

qa_pair.question: How long with the heater run on low with a propane small cannister?
qa_pair.answer: about an hour. you'll have to buy a 5 foot hose with a regulator an a propane tank for a grill. the bigger the tank say 100 lb. will last about a week depending on how long you let it heat. one thing it does heat. if you purchase read an understand the instructions.

qa_pair.question: How long with the heater run on low with a propane small cannister?

summary: The propane tanks for this product are disposable. Keep in mind that you have to purchase the company's extension hose and filter kit.  This personal heater is very light weight & portable. If you pick it up, it automatically turns off, so it's great around kids and pets. The heater is ready to go, but you'll need propane. With the adapter hose, it will support anything from a grill size 20 to whatever has the same connection.

qa_pair.question: The Kraus website states that this sink will fit a 24" cabinet.  Some websites agree & others say 24" is too small.  What's the correct answer? Thanks
qa_pair.answer: My sink measures 23 inches wide including the lip, and it is installed in a 30 inch sink cabinet. Remember, a 24 inch cabinet means that the outside width is 24 inches. So it depends - do you have just a sink front without side walls? Then maybe you can squeeze it in, but would have trouble getting the clips in place, if you need those. If you have a 24" sink cabinet with 1/2 or 3/4 inch plywood box construction, then definitely not. A drop in style sink might give you a little more wiggle room.

qa_pair.question: The Leland pull-down has a wide spray/seems to get water all over the back of the sink on counter/granite behind faucet,does this faucet spray messy?

summary: This product's handle is 2 5/8" tall, counting from the base. This sink head comes with a 3 hole plate, but there isn't a matching bronze hole cover for an existing 4th hole. This faucet will create a messy spray depending on the depth of your sink. Standard and shallow depth sinks will create a mess, so it is better to have a deep sink. This product's pullout head is covered in brushed nickel, but the inner parts and switch are plastic. The product works well and is solid. This products uses a Delta Diamond Seal that keeps water lead-free and free from contact with other contaminates. This product doesn't come with a pause button. It will continue to sprat until you switch it to the steady stream mode. The product handle doesn't need clearance behind it because it only moves forward and straight. There isn't back rotation towards the back. This product provides plenty of water in spray mode. The small size isn't a problem, and it provides sufficient water flow. Note that his faucet doesn't have Touch20 tech.

qa_pair.question: Does this measure temperature?
qa_pair.answer: This multimeter comes with MS3206, an adapter with hookups for diodes and thermocouples.  Unfortunately the thermocouple sockets are useless on this multimeter.  When used with other Mastech multimeters, such as the MS8217, this adapter + a thermocouple will read temperature.

qa_pair.question: Is the lid spring loaded to open.
qa_pair.answer: Yes, you put in your private code and the lid will pop open. However it doesn't open all the way. It only opens far enough to slide your fingers in and raise it the rest of the way. qa_pair.question: What in the world is the difference is "wood" and "paint" sanding discs??
qa_pair.answer: Sandpaper is basically aluminum oxide particles glued on a substrate.  When removing paint, the areas between the sand particles can clog quickly rendering the paper unusable.  Certain manufacturers sell paper for "paint" sanding that is more resistant to clogging and theoretically should last longer. If your goal is to just sand bare wood, start with a course grit i.e.. 80 and then use progressively higher numbers until you get the desired smoothness.

summary: The product is labeled as having 3000mAH, and at 150 lumens is as bright as some three hundred lumens lights. This is an excellent product that can be used on camping trips as part of your equipment, and it uses a 18650 rechargeable battery that is included. qa_pair.question: Is it good for a patrolling officer?
qa_pair.answer: Absolutely perfect. Built sturdy, bright enough light, and has the two settings. Low first and then bright. You can barely press for momentary or click for full time. This light is awesome.

rewrite.edit: Low first and then bright. You can barely press for momentary or click for full time. This light is awesome.

qa_pair.question: Is it good for a patrolling officer?
qa_pair.answer: Hell yeah. this thing qualifies as a search spot light. It is extremely bright. Short battery life on 500 lumens but is awesome.  I would recommend this with no problem.

qa_pair.question: Is it good for a patrolling officer?
qa_pair.answer: Absolutely , Expectedly you will burn up the battery in high mode under constant use,but used Correctly it's a Great light

qa_pair.question: Is it good for a patrolling officer?
qa_pair.answer: It's bright settings are ideal. The high brightness is super bright, plus you can learn a trick by strobing between the high and low beam, a great tool to alert people. It is small, and I would recommend getting the belt clip or sheath for it. It's a great and bright light, I would definitely recommend it.

qa_pair.question: Is it good for a patrolling officer?
qa_pair.answer: Yes - intense light with good battery life about 2 hrs continuous useage.  However if you want a personal carry with strobe function you will need to look at their law enforcement models.  Only draw back with the law enforcement models is that they are longer and heavier than the P2X

qa_pair.question: Is it good for a patrolling officer?
qa_pair.answer: That depends on your requirements.  What qualities do you consider important for a flashlight?

qa_pair.question: Is it good for a patrolling officer?
qa_pair.answer: I'm not a patrolling officer, but I would think that this dual mode flashlight would be perfect for such a person.   The low beam would conserve battery life while certainly allowing plenty of light for finding one's way through the dark.  During moments of greater need, the high beam can be quickly accessed and will provide a blinding beam of light.  Again, being able to limit the use of high beam to moments of real need, you will extend the life of your batteries.

qa_pair.question: Does this have a lot of light on the periphery, or does it reach out and pinpoint like a spotlight?  The P3X has a lot of light on the edge.
qa_pair.answer: More periphery than spotlight.  It throws a very broad and balanced beam. Up close the light looks green but far out it makes everything look like it's in High Def. Very bright and very clear light.  Probably the best quality you can get in a flashlight at the price.

rewrite.edit: Very bright and very clear light. Probably the best quality you can get in a flashlight at the price.

qa_pair.question: Does this have a lot of light on the periphery, or does it reach out and pinpoint like a spotlight?  The P3X has a lot of light on the edge.
qa_pair.answer: It's a spotlight on low beam but covers a wide area on high. This is my husband's favorite flashlight because of its versatility.

qa_pair.question: are the nembers  1 - 10 for any specific job ?
qa_pair.answer: It is used to apply the torque and speed required for specific applications I.e power required for drilling through certain textures.

rewrite.edit: torque and speed required for specific applications I.e power required for drilling through certain textures
power required for drilling through certain textures.

qa_pair.question: are the nembers  1 - 10 for any specific job ?
qa_pair.answer: they are settings for the clutch mechanism. If you set it on one, the clutch breaks loose (disengages) with little torque - that is little pressure. Use the lower settings for delicate items - plastic, thin aluminum, decorative brass, etc. set at 10, you get the highest clutch/highest torque setting. Use this for hard woods, metals, etc. Hope this helps.

qa_pair.question: are the nembers  1 - 10 for any specific job ?
qa_pair.answer: 1 through 10 represent the torque of the drive.

qa_pair.question: Can this be used on concrete? or does that really depend on the bit alone?
qa_pair.answer: A masonry bit is essential to drill concrete but since it's usually a long, drawn out process, I would only consider a corded drill.

qa_pair.question: Can this be used on concrete? or does that really depend on the bit alone?
qa_pair.answer: I think it can be used using a mansonry bit properly! I´ve never used on concrete before. But it does not have the IMPACT function, so if the concrete is very hard, I dont think it could do the job very fast.

qa_pair.question: Can this be used on concrete? or does that really depend on the bit alone?
qa_pair.answer: If you need to drill into concrete firstly you must use a masonry bit, then the thickness of the concrete you need to drill would determine what drill is required, I haven't attempted to use my Black and Decker for concrete drilling as I believe that you need a corded power drill for this type of work and as I have a Makita corded drill I use that, however even this drill struggles on some concrete drilling jobs. So to answer your query I would have to say I think this drill would have it's work cut out to handle concrete drilling.

qa_pair.question: Can this be used on concrete? or does that really depend on the bit alone?

summary: This product works in the dark. If an animal happens to pass the motion detector field, the light will be activated. Even plants moving in the wind activate the light. If you use the light on its base, you can adjust it.  Put your hand over the light sensor to check that it's working. You can set the light to turn off after 20 to 60 seconds. This light has no remote control. It is just a battery-operated motion sensor device. Because these lights are motion activated, they don't use much battery.

This product is a drill that works with 120 v and a charger. To drill through certain textures but you will need a masonry bit. The torque is 310 vs 115 inch/lbs. This product works with a regular outlet with house voltage and you would need a foreign travel adapter set to use in most of Europe.

qa_pair.question: Can this be turned on a different levels or just full bore?
qa_pair.answer: In order to turn this element to lower power, you either need to supply it with a lower voltage (run it at 120V instead of 240) or you have to drive it using a controller. A controller could be of a PWM style (50% power would be to turn it on for 50% of the time, then off for 50% of the time, but switch really quickly) or of a phase angle control style.Just search for heating element controller and you should be able to find a few companies selling them (or search on forums to build your own)

To adjust this element to a different power level, either lower voltage needs to be supplied (120V instead of 240), or the element must be driven using a controller of either PWM style (50% power would be to turn the element on for 50% of the time, then off for 50% of the time, but switch really quickly) or phase angle control style. Heating element controllers are sold online by a few companies, and instructions for self-building a controller can be found on forums.

qa_pair.question: Can this be turned on a different levels or just full bore?
qa_pair.answer:
You can control this by using a PID, an SSR with a PWM circuit, or a SSR-V, which is an SSR to which you can just connect a potentiometer to control its on/off state. The element itself is either on or off, but using one of those options you are basically cutting power in and out to the element at set intervals (which may be on the order of milliseconds or up to seconds at a time, depending on which you use). I use an SSR-V and a potentiometer only, and it works great. I can basically turn it full on or full off, or anywhere in between. If I were doing it again, I'd use a PID, and I probably will upgrade soon.

qa_pair.question: can the imapct driver be used on Car Lug nuts?
qa_pair.answer: Although it is powerful enough for household jobs, it does not have the torque for lug nuts - plus its life will be greatly shortened by using it for so demanding a task. The torque with a fully charged battery is barely enough to safely tighten lug nuts on small cars. Larger cars and pickups need almost twice the torque. Removal is another story - three (3) to five(5) times the torque is needed to remove lug nuts, more if they are rusty. Do not use this tool for lug nuts.

summary: -cThis product cannot be mounted to a 2x4 without additional fabrication. It will clamp on a 2" by 2" square box tubing. The motor controls the hoist in both directions. The yellow controller has a button for each. There is a bracket through which you could run a chain without having to meld a hook. It holds the load as long as you don't exceed the weight limit. summary: This product will fit an older home window with 10 inches that extend from 21 inches to 37 inches. You can position the frame vertically for tall windows but horizontal works best. The louvers expand as well to let a nice breeze in the house. The metal louvers are not removable from the screen and the only way to separate the metal louvers from the screen is removing them from the window. qa_pair.question: what does SJTW mean?
qa_pair.answer: SJTW stands for Hard service cord, thermoplastic constructed jacket, 300 volt, weather resistant for outdoor use.S = service, J = Junior, T = Thermoplastic/Vinyl, W-A = Weather ApprovedOne source for this informatiion is http://www.uswireandcable.com/glossary.html

qa_pair.question: what does SJTW mean?
qa_pair.answer: SJTW is an industry abbreviation used on wire and cable. S is for service; J for junior (which means hard service instead of extra hard); T is the coating (thermoplastic/vinyl); W is weather approved.  It is a hard service, thermoplastic cable rated for 300V and approved for outdoor use.  I agree it is avery good cable for the price.

qa_pair.question: what does SJTW mean?

qa_pair.question: will this cord do well in the rain?
qa_pair.answer: The SJTW in the description of the product describes how it should be used. S means that this cord is rated for Hard Service, J means it is rated for up to 300Volts (though this is just a rating and will be plugged in to a 125 Volt home outlet), T means the coating is Thermoplastic, and W means it is rated for Weather/Outdoor Use. If connected properly and the ends are shielded from direct water penetration then yes, this cord should work well in the rain as it is rated for it.

qa_pair.question: will this sharpen a convex grid?
qa_pair.answer: It will ONLY apply a convex grind - that's the benefit of a belt sharpening system. A convex grind is stronger than a flat grind (stone) or hollow grind (wheel) and will stay sharper longer.

You only need to pull a knife through for less than 3 to 5 seconds per side. When the angle has been achieved it only takes one or two swipes to keep the blades sharp once they are dull. qa_pair.question: are  these hex shank bits
qa_pair.answer: No, they are definitely NOT hex shank bits. They must be put in a Jacobs chuck. The larger bits have three flats on the shank to inhibit slippage in the chuck, but these are not designed for use in a ¼", "snap in" hex chuck.

qa_pair.question: are  these hex shank bits
qa_pair.answer: The small bits have round shanks. The medium and large bits have three flats milled in the shank, each flat being 120 degrees apart. The flats should be aligned with the three jaws in your drill chuck. If you do that, the medium to large drills will never spin in the chuck.

qa_pair.question: are  these hex shank bits
qa_pair.answer: The nine largest bits (ranging from 3/16 to 1/2 inch) do have hex shanks.  The smaller bits from 1/16 to 11/64 inch have round shanks.  I've been very satisfied with these drill bits because they are sharp and so far have remained sharp with moderate use.

qa_pair.question: Can the PLUG (prongs) end be removed and be replaced if needed for repair or is it  permantently installed molded/sealed?
qa_pair.answer: You would only want to have it repaired by returning it to the manufacturer (Champion) to have the work done.  By doing otherwise would surely void the warranty, and possibly expose you to a dangerous situation if the work were not done properly.  In addition, you could also be exposing yourself to expensive litigation should an incident occur (example: house fire) during the use of this cable following repairs by other than the manufacturer.

Since this cable requires a portable generator with an L14-30R 120/240 volt Twist-Lock female receptacle, it makes no difference where the portable generator/cable combination are located.  If a portable generator with this cable installed produces the results you require in the US, then you will get the same results when you ship them both overseas.  This cable is not designed or intended to be connected to a local power grid.  If the appliances that you are going to plug into any of the four 5-20R 120 volt female receptacles on the delivery end of this cable, require anything other than 120 volts with a maximum of 20 amps of power, then the generator/cable combination will not work, regardless of where they are located.

qa_pair.question: Can anyone comment on what the proper battery care is if you own three total batteries? When you only really use just one on a normal basis..
qa_pair.answer: First of all store them fully charged. Keep them cool (not cold, above freezing) Don't run the battery all the way down before charging it. Lithium Ion batteries don't develop a memory so change them often while using. Alternate between the batteries.

qa_pair.question: How many starting amps does it draw.
qa_pair.answer: About 6 amps is average for a 1/3 hp motor operating at 120 volt. Its a good idea to have it on a dedicated circuit or a circuit thats " known" not to have alot of load on it.

rewrite.edit: a good idea to have it on a dedicated circuit or a circuit thats " known" not to have alot of load on it.

qa_pair.question: How many starting amps does it draw.
qa_pair.answer: Actually #12 wire should be used with a 20Amp breaker. NEC only requires #14 to be used with a 15 amp circuit breaker. So #14 wire should be sufficient

qa_pair.question: How many starting amps does it draw.
qa_pair.answer: I have the M98, 1/2 HP version of this pump.  The cord uses 16 gauge wire.  In a pinch I have run it (to drain holes) on a 100', 14 gauge extension cord and it ran fine all day long.  I am NOT suggesting doing any sort of permanent installation using an extension cord, but these things are built TOUGH and you really don't need too much electrical overkill.  Besides, if it has a plugged cord it doesn't require a dedicated circuit, although that might be a smart idea.  My crawl space sumps ARE on dedicated circuits.

qa_pair.question: How many starting amps does it draw.
qa_pair.answer: I did not have a meter to measure the start amperage, however, pump was connected to a builder installed 20 amp curcuit that supplies my sump pump and water softener, and there have been no instances of a thrown breaker since pump installed or with old pump.

qa_pair.question: The ebay listingsays that "MAIL CHIME  works on slot... mailboxes". How would it would work for slot mailboxes if the postman does not open the door?
qa_pair.answer: It would have to work only on a slot mailbox that has some type of mechanism that allows the motion sensor to be moved.  I use a "driveway alert" fixed motion sensor that is perfect.  When the mail is dropped into the slot, the mail slips past the sensor and it triggers the "alert" to send a signal to the receiver in the house.

qa_pair.question: The ebay listingsays that "MAIL CHIME  works on slot... mailboxes". How would it would work for slot mailboxes if the postman does not open the door?
qa_pair.answer: It attaches to the mail box door and activates upon opening the door. (A tip switch I believe) It does not activate unless it is tipped.  It would work if your mail slot has a door or flapper that opens and you can attach it to the door/flapper.

qa_pair.question: The ebay listingsays that "MAIL CHIME  works on slot... mailboxes". How would it would work for slot mailboxes if the postman does not open the door?

It doesn't even weigh a pound but they're probably referring to shipping weight which includes the carrying case, 2 batteries and the charger with the driver. The driver alone with a battery and bit installed is a pound or less. This item accepts the standard size for electric screwdrivers,  you can use it to remove stripped metal screws about 2 and a half inches long. There is a small button to activate the LED light when needed. It's located on the grip near the top. Hope that helps. It comes with a hard case, a charger, 2 batteries, and a Phillips bit and the charger has a sticker made in China.

This product comes with a hard case, a charger, 2 batteries, and a Phillips bit. This model has a high speed of 600 rpm and a low speed of 200 rpm that can be selected via a switch on the top of the unit. The manufacturer website states that the product has a max torque of 44 inches per pound. The driver a with a battery and bit installed weighs a pound or less. There is a small button to activate the LED light located on the grip near the top. This product accepts the standard size for electric screwdrivers and can remove a stripped metal screw about 2 and half inches long. The charger is made in China.

qa_pair.question: Does it come with any pin/stake etc to put in the ground?
qa_pair.answer: Yes,  it has a 6" cast pot metal metal stake that is sufficient if you have non-corrosive soil.  The stake screws on to the base of the light fixture. qa_pair.question: What size breaker, and wire do you need to feed this box?
qa_pair.answer: We used 4 gauge copper wires (3 ea.), but had 4 boxes feeding off them.  A single box could be run off 6 gauge.

qa_pair.question: What size breaker, and wire do you need to feed this box?
qa_pair.answer: I ran the #8 from the exterior load center to the Talon box underground, inside Carlon PVC conduit.  You can get direct burial wire but the conduit is just a safer choice.  A 50 amp breaker will work for this purpose.

qa_pair.question: What size breaker, and wire do you need to feed this box?
qa_pair.answer: 50 amp breaker and #8 copper wire.

qa_pair.question: What size breaker, and wire do you need to feed this box?
qa_pair.answer: Check with your electrical inspector.  That being said I used 2 of the available spaces and mounted a 100 amp main.  Still have 2 extra spaces and doubt I'll ever come close to using more than 100 amp.  No main was required by local codes but I like to be able to kill all power to box.  Hope this helped.

qa_pair.question: What size breaker, and wire do you need to feed this box?
qa_pair.answer: #8 and if your feeding from another box I would use 75 amp minimum.  Comes with 50amp+30amp+20amp=100amps.  I think 100amp is the way to go

qa_pair.question: Does the handle of the faucet need to be in the on position for the faucet to work?  Does the module have a temperature setting or is it the last temp
qa_pair.answer: Yes, it needs to be in the on position.  If you are asking if there is a way to adjust the temperature (or speed of flow) without touching the handle, there is not.  You can turn it on or off by waving at it, but the rate of water and the temperature will be whatever you set the handle to last.

qa_pair.question: Does the handle of the faucet need to be in the on position for the faucet to work?  Does the module have a temperature setting or is it the last temp
qa_pair.answer: The faucet handle must be in the "on" position for the faucet to function.  If the faucet is left running without any other activity, it will shut off after a minute or so as to avoid water use being used unintentionally.The faucet will operate at the last temperature used while running or at the temperature set when turned on thereafter.

qa_pair.question: Does the handle of the faucet need to be in the on position for the faucet to work?  Does the module have a temperature setting or is it the last temp
qa_pair.answer: The handle does need to be in the "on" position for the touch sensor to work. Whatever position the handle is in also sets the amount of flow and the temperature. So, I leave it in my preferred position all the time, but can easily adjust the water using the handle. Basically, you always have the option of using the handle as an "over ride."

qa_pair.question: Does the faucet return to stream after using it in spray mode and then shutting it off?  One of the reviews said it doesn't return to stream.
qa_pair.answer: On/off has no effect on spray or stream.  When turned back on it is in the last mode selected (spray it stream) as when shut off

qa_pair.question: Does the faucet return to stream after using it in spray mode and then shutting it off?  One of the reviews said it doesn't return to stream.
qa_pair.answer: The faucet maintains the spray or stream setting after being turned off.  It will turn back on with whatever the last setting was prior to being turned off.  We actually like that feature.  It is no problem at all to change between either mode.  We love the faucet.  It was a much larger benefit to the quality of our life than we ever expected. I highly recommend the faucet.

qa_pair.question: Does the faucet return to stream after using it in spray mode and then shutting it off?  One of the reviews said it doesn't return to stream.

qa_pair.question: Does the faucet return to stream after using it in spray mode and then shutting it off?  One of the reviews said it doesn't return to stream.
qa_pair.answer: No.   The last stream you choose will be what will turn on next time.

qa_pair.question: Does the faucet return to stream after using it in spray mode and then shutting it off?  One of the reviews said it doesn't return to stream.
qa_pair.answer: The faucet maintains the setting when turned off. Therefore it will turn back on with the previous setting of spray or stream. It is not a problem to change between either modes. We LOVE the faucet!!!!

qa_pair.question: Does the faucet return to stream after using it in spray mode and then shutting it off?  One of the reviews said it doesn't return to stream.
qa_pair.answer: There's a button behind the part that separates from the rest so your finger is right near or can be on it.  You can toggle back and forth from stream to spray with the button.  It is quite easy and feels almost automatic.  It is great to use and I love having it!

qa_pair.question: Does the faucet return to stream after using it in spray mode and then shutting it off?  One of the reviews said it doesn't return to stream.
qa_pair.answer: It does not return by itself. There is a two position rocker switch on the back side of the spray head and one position is stream and one position is spray. It stays where it is until you change it. Because the rocker switch is on the back side,it is hidden from view.

qa_pair.question: Does the faucet return to stream after using it in spray mode and then shutting it off?  One of the reviews said it doesn't return to stream.
qa_pair.answer: the faucet returns to what it was when you shut it off, assuming you used the motion senser to do each

summary: This lamp, shades about 64 inches off the floor. The bulb has a white light or a warmer soft light. The product is built-in unlike any other light bulb. When it conks out, the lamp is done but it's going to last a very very long time, so don't worry. Stationary stand pole 49 inches, hinged arm of 20 inches that allows light to be lowered below 49 inches or raised to 67 inches. It has ON/OFF buttons but no dimmer installed. It has a diffuser at the base of the shade, so no glare. A pivot toggle located on top of the pivot arm allows the shade to move up and down.  It has a  customer support web site for instructions.

qa_pair.question: Can i use these for thick aluminum or copper metal? and will they break
qa_pair.answer: I actually haven't tried them for such an application but it is my impression that they will break. I would use much higher quality high speed steel drill bits for non-ferrous metals like copper and aluminum.

qa_pair.question: Can i use these for thick aluminum or copper metal? and will they break
qa_pair.answer: I have not tried them on anything, but they appear to be good tools and well made.  I would not hesitate to try them, especially on Aluminum.  Copper, if it is very thick > 1/8" may need greater care, as copper and brass tend to grab.  Often specially ground drills are used to cut more slowly, but I would not be afraid to try them, especially in a drill press where greater control than a hand held drill is possible.

qa_pair.question: Can i use these for thick aluminum or copper metal? and will they break
qa_pair.answer: They will work on softer metal at slow RPM and using cutting oil to reduce heat and friction. They're not really made for harder metals like steel or cast iron.

qa_pair.answer: Full proof of the gauge size would require cutting the cable and measuring the wire diameter. But all indications are that it is indeed, a genuine 12 gauge conductor. The imprint on the cable reads that it is 12 gauge, and a small bit of the wire that's visible in the translucent connector appears to be 12 gauge. Using it with heavy power tools, there is almost no current lag at startup. So, I'd say it's plenty safe to assume it is 12 gauge.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this cord for 7.0 cu. ft. upright freezers?
qa_pair.answer: I think it should be OK. 12/3 cord is rated for 15 amps. Your freezer probably doesn't pull that much, but you should read the data plate to make sure. Do you really need 25 feet? Something like this is probably a semi-permanent setup so you shouldn't use any longer cord than you need. If you only need 10 feet, buy a 12/3 ten foot cord.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this cord for 7.0 cu. ft. upright freezers?

qa_pair.question: how does it rate for uv resistance
qa_pair.answer: None of these extensions you find on Amazon are rated for UV. If this is a temporary installation, don't worry about it (though you could always enclose the wire in remnant garden hose and heat shrink the ends... if you were determined to do so).  You'll be happier in the long run by having an electrician install outdoor outlets on a short post, away from the structure, which is probably the problem you are working around.

summary: This product only works with DeWalt products in the 20V max series and most tool companies use unique designs for their batteries and tools. The 1.5 AMP and 3 AMP batteries can be used on the same 20V tool. The only difference between these batteries is the run time between needing to be charged. The DCB200 is 3.0 AMPs per hour and the DCB204 is 4.0 Amps per hour. The Black & Decker Battery is designed differently and is not likely to be compatible with this DeWalt product. This product is designed to work with twenty-volt batteries and will work with brushless batteries as well.

qa_pair.question: How many restrictors are needed per door?
qa_pair.answer: I use 1 per hinge.  I don't want one hinge taking all the load when the restrictor engages.  I only had 2 doors that needed restrictors, but bought extra anyway.  Just make sure you get the right ones to fit your hinges.  You can look at Rockler or do some internet searches to be sure which ones will fit.

qa_pair.question: is there a belt holder for this light
qa_pair.answer: No! There is a strap(about 12" long). You could run your wrist through the strap so the flashlight tangles handfree or you could run your trouser belt through the strap so that the flashlight hangs from your belt. The slots mentioned by other helpful users who provided answers below are really small, as big as you could run a few paperclips through them. I doubt any conventional trouser belts fit through them.

qa_pair.question: are these 'warm' enough to use in an artistic ballet's dressing room where a yellow cast is necessary?
qa_pair.answer: The color temperature of those Feit bulbs is 3000K, which is slightly cooler (more bluish) compared to an incandescent bulb. If yellow cast is important, you should look for an LED bulb that says '2700K'. For example:Energetic Lighting ELE12D-AWF-VB LED 12-Watt A19 Dimmable LampBy the way, the color temperature of LED does not change significantly when dimmed.

qa_pair.question: What makes these bulbs "Decorative" as the description mentions?
qa_pair.answer: I don't know about decorative, but they are frosted for use in a vanity or bathroom fixture.  Meaning that the bulbs themselves do not need to be covered by a shade.However, please be aware that they are not "instant on."  I am using  these bulbs in the same fixture with non-LED bulbs.  The LED bulbs light up half a second after the non-LED bulbs, which is disconcerting.

qa_pair.question: What makes these bulbs "Decorative" as the description mentions?
qa_pair.answer: They are not standard lightbulb-shaped (A19) but round globes. They would look strange in a table lamp. Instead  they are usually used in groups over bathroom mirrors.  I agree with the other person that there is a brief delay in starting.

qa_pair.question: What makes these bulbs "Decorative" as the description mentions?
qa_pair.answer: I think it's simply the bulb style.  These are very large bulbs typically found in bathroom vanity lighting, and in such a place the entire bulb is exposed.  It'd be hard to put these in already-decorative lamps and such because of their size.

qa_pair.question: What makes these bulbs "Decorative" as the description mentions?
qa_pair.answer: The fact that they have a frosted glass dome over the lighting element. This allows it to be in those Hollywood dressing room style bathroom fixtures that are basically bulbs in a row.

qa_pair.question: What makes these bulbs "Decorative" as the description mentions?
qa_pair.answer: They're the round kind that go above a bathroom mirror--kind of like the old makeup mirrors. They're not intended to go under a lamp shade.

summary: This product is a package of 3 bulbs, great for those light fixtures in a lot of bathrooms with these type bulbs, much brighter than cfl bulbs. The diameter is about 3 inches. They are definitely much cooler than CFL, you can touch it when it's on and the color is closer to an orange. Compared to an incandescent bulb. If yellow cast is important, you should look for an LED bulb that says '2700K'. For example:Energetic Lighting ELE12D-AWF-VB LED 12-Watt A19 Dimmable Lamp. They have "medium" sized base, compatible withe the regular E27 socket and the shape of the bulb is different than a regular bulb so they are very decorative.

qa_pair.question: How durable is this baton exactly? If someone were to land a full-fledged blow on an assailant's body with this, how likely is it that it would break?
qa_pair.answer: Anything is breakable at some point but the barbarian is made of two metal pieces that is held together by several metal threads that is screwed several time, where the handle meets the baton portion. It won't likely break with a body blow. However, there are other models in the market that are partially soft plastic which will break very easily, this one is metal.

qa_pair.question: what's the body material ? aluminum ?
qa_pair.answer: Not really sure.  It weighs only 1.25 lbs. and is a little more than 19 inches long.  When swinging it, it feels quite solid.  I think aluminum would be lighter and not feel as substantial, though they could have come more weighty material placed inside.  It is a formidable weapon...has the charge at the end and also about 6 inches of spiked surface just below the end.  Fortunately I haven't had to use it yet, but it does give me a measure of security hanging next to my bed.  I hope this helps...

summary: This product is well made using heavy gauge aircraft-grade aluminum. The product includes a stun gun, strap, recharging cord that plugs into a standard wall outlet, and a clip that is attached to the baton for you to clip on your belt or pants. The total length of this product is 19 inches and the length of the handle/grip is 5 inches. The studded area around the top is also electrified and is made of superior quality. The charge on this product holds for over a month and is easily rechargeable. The product is made of two metal pieces that are held together by several metal threads that are screwed several times where the handle meets the baton portion.
